description: Import a Windows operating system image from a verified Microsoft ISO disk file. The following disk images are supported:

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the image resource that's created from the import.

parameters.name: semanticVersion
parameters.description: The semantic version to attach to the image that's created during the import process. This version follows the semantic version syntax.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: The operating system platform for the imported image. Allowed values include the following: Windows.

parameters.name: osVersion
parameters.description: The operating system version for the imported image. Allowed values include the following: Microsoft Windows 11.

parameters.name: infrastructureConfigurationArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration resource that's used for launching the EC2 instance on which the ISO image is built.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The uri of the ISO disk file that's stored in Amazon S3.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags that are attached to image resources created from the import. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure idempotency of the request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon EC2 API Reference. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: clientToken
nested_items.description: The client token that uniquely identifies the request.

nested_items.name: imageBuildVersionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the output AMI that was created from the ISO disk file.
